thread.title: 10-day Indian summer scorcher to blast Britain as maps go deep crimson
thread.title_full: 10-day Indian summer scorcher to blast Britain as maps go deep crimson

author: https://www.dailystar.co.uk/authors/adam-cailler/
title: 10-day Indian summer scorcher to blast Britain as maps go deep crimson
text:
Brits are set to bask in a 10-day blast of hot sunshine, with the mercury rising as high as 21C in some parts of England, just days after a wet start to the month Something went wrong, please try again later.

Millions of Brits are poised to enjoy a 10-day heatwave in the coming days, following a rain-drenched start to the month, according to recent weather maps.
Netweather's forecast data indicates temperatures could reach up to 21 degrees in England on October 17, with no area south of the Scottish border expected to see maximum temperatures below 14C. London and its surrounding regions are predicted to experience the highest temperatures of around 20-21C, while Birmingham, Liverpool and Manchester can expect temperatures between 16 and 18C, as per the latest charts.
Scotland is likely to be slightly chillier overall on that day, with temperatures only reaching as high as 11C in some parts, although Edinburgh is set to hit around 15C at its peak and a warm 17C is forecast along the English border.
READ MORE: UK high street closure crisis claid bare in images of abandoned TGI Fridays
Click for more of the latest news from across the world from the Daily Star.
In contrast, Wales is anticipated to see temperatures ranging between 15 and 17C, with Northern Ireland predicted to have temperatures of 13-14C, reports the Express.
(Image: (Image: Netweather))
Subsequent maps suggest the warmer temperatures will persist over the nextâ€¦
